passage_0.passage: A 200 seat theater charges 3.00 dollars for adults and 1.50 dollars for children

qa_pairs.question: If all seats were filled and the total ticket income was 510 dollars how many adults and children were in the audience?

passage_1.passage: A student is pricing 2 different picture packages. John 's Photo World charges 2.75 dollars per sheet and a one time sitting fee of 125 dollars. Sam 's Picture Emporium charges 1.50 dollars per sheet and a one time sitting fee of 140 dollars

qa_pairs.question: For how many sheets of pictures do the 2 companies charge the same amount?

passage_2.passage: 0.6667 of a number increased by 0.75 is 1

qa_pairs.question: 6667 , what is the number?

passage_3.passage: A cashier has a total of 126 bills , made up of 5-dollar bills and 10-dollar bills. The total value of the money is 840 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many 5-dollar bills does he have? How many 10-dollar bills?

passage_4.passage: When 4 times the number is added to 7 times the number the result is 55

qa_pairs.question: What is the number?

passage_5.passage: Steve invests in a circus production. The coast includes an overhead of 81,000 dollars , plus production costs of 7,000 dollars per performance. A sold-out performance brings in 16,000 dollars , Determine the number of sold-out performances , x , needed to break even

passage_6.passage: A car rents for 30 dollars per day plus 18 cents per mile. You are on a budget of 75 dollars

qa_pairs.question: What mileage would allow you to stay within your budget?

passage_7.passage: One number is 3 less than twice another. If their sum is 39 , find the numbers

passage_8.passage: The difference between two numbers is 20 and their sum is 48. Find the numbers

passage_9.passage: An athlete can burn 10 calories per minute while running and 4 calories per minute while walking

qa_pairs.question: If the athlete burns 450 calories in 60 minutes , how many minutes are spent running? How many minutes are spent walking?

passage_10.passage: Wal-Mart sells thermometers for 2 dollars and hot-water bottles for 6 dollars . In December , Wal-Mart 's total sales for these two items was 1200 dollars. Customers bought 7 times as many thermometers as hot-water bottles

qa_pairs.question: How many thermometers did Wal-Mart sell? How many hot-water bottles?

passage_11.passage: There are 11 animals in a barnyard. Some are chickens and some are cows. There are 38 legs in all

qa_pairs.question: How many chickens and cows are in the barnyard?

passage_12.passage: A woman is paid 20 dollars for each day she works and forfeits 5 dollars for each day she is idle. At the end of 25 days she nets 450 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many days did she work?

passage_13.passage: Safety Rent-a-Car rents an intermediate-size car at a daily rate of 21.95 dollars plus 0.19 per mile. City Rentals rent an intermediate-size car for 18.95 dollars plus 0.21 per mile

qa_pairs.question: For what milage is the cost the same?

passage_14.passage: A theater sold 900 tickets to a play. Floor seats cost 12 dollars each and balcony seats 10 dollars each. Total receipts were 9,780 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many floor seats were sold? How many balcony seats were sold?

passage_15.passage: The sum of 2 numbers is 64 and their difference is 18

qa_pairs.question: What is the first number? What is the second number?

passage_16.passage: Suppose you invest 1,500 dollars in equipment to put pictures on T-shirts. You buy each T-shirt for 3 dollars. After you have placed the pictures on a shirt , you sell it for 20 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many T-shirts must you sell to break even?

passage_17.passage: Sara and Jim both decided to save some money each week. Sara has already saved 4100 dollars , and she plans to save 10 dollars a week. Jim plans to save 15 dollars a week

qa_pairs.question: In how many weeks will Jim and Sara have saved the same amount?

passage_18.passage: Find two numbers whose sum is 14 if one number is 3 times as large as the other number

passage_19.passage: In 1 week , a music store sold 9 guitars for a total of of 3611 dollars. Electric guitars sold for 479 dollars each and acoustic guitars sold for 339 dollars each

qa_pairs.question: How many electric guitars were sold? How many acoustic guitars were sold?

passage_20.passage: An employment agency specializing in temporary construction help pays heavy equipment operators 140 dollars per day and general laborers 90 dollars per day

qa_pairs.question: If 35 people were hired and the payroll was 3950 dollars , how many heavy equipment operators were employed? How many laborers were employed?
Find the number whose double is 45 greater than its half?

passage_22.passage: A cosmetologist has a bottle of 7 % hydrogen peroxide solution and a bottle of 4 % hydrogen peroxide solution. The cosmetologist needs 300 milliliters of a 5 % hydrogen peroxide solution. Find how many milliliters of each solution the cosmetologist needs to mix together

passage_23.passage: A washer and a dryer cost 600 dollars combined. The price of the washer is 3 times the price of the dryer

qa_pairs.question: What is the cost of the dryer?

passage_24.passage: Tennis rackets can be packaged in cartons holding 2 rackets each or in cartons holding 3 rackets each. Yesterday 's packing slip showed that 38 cartons were used to pack a total of 100 rackets

qa_pairs.question: How many cartons of 2 rackets size were used yesterday? How many cartons of 3 rackets size were used yesterday?

passage_25.passage: High school graduating class is made up of 466 students. There are 212 more girls than boys

qa_pairs.question: How many boys are in the class?

passage_26.passage: For the first performance of a play in a community theater , 50 reserved-seat tickets and 80 general-admission tickets were sold. The total receipts were 980 dollars. For the second performance , 60 reserved-seat tickets and 90 general-admission tickets were sold. The total receipts were 1140 dollars. Find the price of a reserved-set ticket , in dollars. Find the price of a general-admission ticket

passage_27.passage: You are selling tickets for a high school play. Student tickets cost 4 dollars and general admission tickets cost 6 dollars. You sell 525 tickets and collect 2876 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many student tickets and general admission tickets did you sell?

passage_28.passage: The Lakers scored a total of 80 points in a basketball game against the Bulls. The Lakers made a total of 37 baskets , consisting of 2 point baskets and 3 point baskets

qa_pairs.question: How many 2 point baskets did the Lakers make? How many 3 point baskets did the Lakers make?

passage_29.passage: At its Grand Opening , the Guthrie Market distributed two different types of souvenirs. One type cost 20 cents each , and the other type cost 25 cents each. One thousand souvenirs were distributed in all. If the cost of these souvenirs was 220 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many of 20 cents and 25 cents souveniers were distributed?

passage_30.passage: 2 cars start at the same place and time , and travel in opposite directions. One car is traveling 15 kilometers per hour faster than the other. After 5 hours , the 2 cars are 275 km apart. Find the speed of each car

passage_31.passage: A high school graduating class is made up of 485 students. There are 69 more girls than boys

qa_pairs.question: How many boys are in the class?

passage_32.passage: Jack collects baseball and football cards. He has 125 cards total. The number of baseball cards he has is five more than three times the number of football cards

qa_pairs.question: How many baseball and football cards does he have?

passage_33.passage: El Segundo High School put on their annual musical. The students sold 650 tickets for a value of 4375 dollars. If orchestra seats cost 7.50 dollars and balcony seats cost 3

qa_pairs.question: 50 dollars , how many orchestra seats were sold , and how many balcony seats were sold?
There are 30 legs and 13 heads of goats and chicken , so how may goats and chicken are there?

passage_35.passage: The sum of two numbers is 32 and the difference is 14. Find the two numbers

passage_36.passage: During a sale an automobile dealer sold 69 cars and trucks

qa_pairs.question: If she sold 27 more cars than trucks how many trucks did she sell?

passage_37.passage: Your teacher is giving you a test worth 100 points and containing 40 questions. There are 2 point and 4 point questions on the test

qa_pairs.question: How many two point questions are there? How many 4 point questions?

passage_38.passage: In a class of 35 students the number of girls is 0.4 of the number of boys. Find the number of girls in the class

passage_39.passage: a grocer wants to mix nuts which sell for rs 4 per kilo with nuts which sell for rs 7 per kilo in order to make a mixture which could sell for rs 5 per kilo

qa_pairs.question: How many kilos of each should he mix to get a mixture of 42 kilos?
How many liters of 5 % saline solution and 25 % saline solution must be mixed together to get 10 liters of 18 % saline solution?

passage_41.passage: Tickets for a show cost 6.00 dollars for adults and 4.50 dollars for children. 400 tickets were sold for a total of 2100 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many adult tickets and how many childrens tickets were sold?

passage_42.passage: Find a number so that 10 less than 0.6667 the number is 0.25 the number

passage_43.passage: A farmhouse has 15 animals. Some are goats and some are ducks. Altogether there are 48 legs

qa_pairs.question: How many of each animal are there?

passage_44.passage: For a matinee , a movie theater charges 4.50 dollars for children and 6.75 dollars for adults. At today 's matinee , there are 20 more children than adults and the total receipts are 405 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many children are at today 's matinee?

passage_45.passage: Mary can purchase roses and daisies from a flower shop. She can buy four roses and five daisies for 7.90 dollars or two roses and six daisies for 5.70 dollars

qa_pairs.question: What is the individual cost for each rose and daisy?

passage_46.passage: There are some 2-dollar coins and some 5-dollar coins. There are 40 coins , which give a total amount of 125 dollars

qa_pairs.question: How many 2-dollar coins are there? How many 5-dollar coins are there?
